meanings.sent1: The rain was blemishing the freshly painted fence.
meanings.sent2: She accidentally spilled coffee on her white shirt, blemishing it.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy was blemishing the garden by digging up the flowers.
meanings.sent4: The graffiti artist was blemishing the city walls with colorful designs.
meanings.sent5: The scratch on the car's paint was blemishing its shiny surface.

meanings.definition: To make (something) imperfect or less attractive by the addition of something unattractive
meanings.sent1: The sticker on the laptop was blemishing its sleek look.
meanings.sent2: The mold growing on the bread was blemishing its freshness.
meanings.sent3: The clown's attempt at makeup was blemishing his face with colorful streaks.
meanings.sent4: The negative comments were blemishing the otherwise positive feedback.
meanings.sent5: The dust on the mirror was blemishing the reflection, making it unclear.
